other_tests.findings: Normal karyotype (46, XX) and uniparental disomy 7 was not present.
A homozygous mutation in the BLM gene c.2643G>A (p.Thr881X) confirmed Bloom syndrome.
Maximum GH response of 13.5 μg/L (35 mU/L) for Patient 1 and 21.5 μg/L (56 mU/L) for Patient 2.
Normal thyroid function at the start of GH treatment.
other_tests.changes_over_time: TSH levels increased to 9.7 mU/L at 13 years of age for Patient 1.

other_tests.findings: Showed characteristics in line with cutaneous lupus erythematosus.
Hypertelorism, mild down slant, somewhat pointed nose with a wide base, full lips, clinodactyly of the hands and feet.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The dysmorphic features became more prominent over time.
